title: Collection.0.94.0
description: This schema defines the base Collection object used throughout the data model.  A Collection is a group of one or more resources, all of the same MemberType.

MemberType.description: This property has the type of members in this collection.  All of the members of a collection all have the same value for their Type property, thus they are all the same kind of resource.
MemberType.specification: This property shall represent the value of the Type property of the collection member, including only major version number.

Total.description: This is the total number of members and not just the amount on any given page.
Total.specification: This property shall contain the total number of collection members.

id.specification: This property shall contain the identifier value of linked resource.  The value shall contain the partial URI of the member under the Collection such that a client shall be able to access the resource by appending the URI of the collection with the value of this property.

href.specification: The value of this property shall be of the format for the reserved word *href* as described in the Redfish specification.

frag.specification: This property shall contain a JSON Pointer (RFC 6902) fragement to member of Items array.  This property shall be required if the Items array is returned in the resource.

items.description: There are three types of links used in Redfish and this structure holds them.  Basically, href is a standard URI, frag is a JSON Pointer to the index in the Items array and id can be used to form a URI by appending it to the URI of this collection.  You can see the spec for more details.

Member.description: This object shall be used to represent the Collection member link information.  If the resource is individually addressable, there shall be either an href property or an id property.

page.description: This page number can be used in a query on the URI to get the next page.
page.specification: This property shall be used to represent the number of the next page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the next page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents a page number and count.  If this is the last page, then the NextPage property shall not be returned.

start.description: This start value can be used in a query on the URI to get the next page.
start.specification: This property shall represent the start item index of the next page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the next page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents the start items index and count.
This object shall contain a reference to destination page.

page.description: This page number can be used in a query on the URI to get the previous page.
page.specification: This property shall be used to represent the number of the previous page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the previous page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents a page number and count.  If this is the first page (page 1) then the PrevPage property shall not be returned.

start.description: This start value can be used in a query on the URI to get the previous page.
start.specification: This property shall represent the start item index of the previous page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the previous page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents the start items index and count.
This object shall contain a reference to destination page.

page.description: This page number can be used in a query on the URI to get the first page.
page.specification: This property shall be used to represent the number of the first page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the first page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents a page number and count.

start.description: This start value can be used in a query on the URI to get the first page.
start.specification: This property shall represent the start item index of the first page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the first page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents the start items index and count.
This object shall contain a reference to destination page.

page.description: This page number can be used in a query on the URI to get the last page.
page.specification: This property shall be used to represent the number of the last page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the last page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents a page number and count.

start.description: This start value can be used in a query on the URI to get the last page.
start.specification: This property shall represent the start item index of the last page.

count.description: This is the number of Items on the last page.
count.specification: This property shall contain the number of resources represented on the referenced page.

oneOf.description: This object represents the start items index and count.
This object shall contain a reference to destination page.

links.description: Array of collection links, including those for members and pagination.

Items.description: This is an optional array of the members of this collection.  The properties of the array can be a subset of those in the actual members.
Items.specification: This property shall be an array of embedded objects of MemberType which are members of this collection.  Implementations may return a subset of properties from the member.  A links object should not be included in the objects in this array.
